Html:
Hello guys,

 

Im having problem creating more than 1024 task in my machine Windows Server 2003 SP2. It seems that there is a limit on the number of task that can be created in a specific account.

Im trying to use system account but still im getting the same problem.

If any of you encountered the same problem. Please help.

Thanks guys,

This is a great project !!! :)

I have just tested this under the 2.0 engine (Vista & Win2K8 Server and later) and there is not this limitation. I would venture that this is a limitation of the 1.0 engine though I have never heard of it. I do not have a system to test this theory on though.

dahall wrote:

I have just tested this under the 2.0 engine (Vista & Win2K8 Server and later) and there is not this limitation. I would venture that this is a limitation of the 1.0 engine though I have never heard of it. I do not have a system to test this theory on though.

Hi dahall,

Thanks for your reply.

I can now create 10,000 tasks in Win2k8 server but the problem the tasks are not triggered anymore.

I scheduled the 10K tasks to run every 1minute.

My machine is 68G RAM, 8 x processor...

 

Thanks,

jemson
